intro: Trichopyrum intermedium subsp. gentryi, commonly known as the Gentry's trichopyrum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to specific regions of North America. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brown flowers. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a lack of rhizomes, distinguishing it from other members of the Poaceae family. It is often found in association with other wetland vegetation, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
